monq.jfa

Class Intervals<D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • monq.jfa.Intervals<D>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntervalsFaState

    public class Intervals<D>
extends java.lang.Object

    Used to construct CharTrans objects of different implementations.

    Author:
    © 2004, 2005, 2015 Harald Kirsch TODO: Either make it generic or store FaState only TODO: replace with an implementation which has a complete Char.MAX_VALUE pair of arrays that is plainly set and overwritten, instead of mainting the intervals. The measure performance.

      • logStats

        public static java.lang.String logStats()

      • resetStats

        public static void resetStats()

      • complete

        public final void complete(D o)

        all intervals which are currently mapped to null will be mapped to the given object.

      • reset

        public final void reset()
        reset to the state of a freshly constructed object. In particular there will be one interval spanning the whole range of char values being mapped to null.

      • size

        public final int size()

      • getAt

        public final D getAt(int i)

         D o)

        public final char getFirstAt(int i)

      • getLastAt

        public final char getLastAt(int i)

      • split

        public final int split(char ch)

        Split whichever interval covers ch at ch and return the position of the left interval. The value stored in the interval to split will be put in both parts.

        Returns:
        either -pos-1 if ch hits exactly the left border of the interval at pos, or pos, if ch lies truly within interval pos.

      • overwrite

        public final void overwrite(char first,
             char last,
             D o)

      • invert

        public final void invert(D o)

        inverts the mapped and unmapped intervals. Intervals which are currently mapped to null will be mapped to o, and those currently mapped to some object are mapped to null.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
